trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the project (not the solution) and click Publish.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the project (not the solution) and click Publish.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Project publish menu option</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Project publish menu option</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Profile tab and click Microsoft Azure API Apps (Preview).
trans-unit.target: Click the Profile tab and click Microsoft Azure API Apps (Preview).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publish Web dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publish Web dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click New to provision a new API App in your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Click New to provision a new API App in your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select Existing API Services dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select Existing API Services dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Create an API App dialog, enter the following:
trans-unit.target: In the Create an API App dialog, enter the following:

trans-unit.source: For API App Name, enter the name you're using for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For API App Name, enter the name you're using for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, select the one you want to use.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, select the one you want to use.

trans-unit.source: For App Service Plan, select from your existing App Service plans, or select Create new App Service plan and enter the name of a new plan.
trans-unit.target: For App Service Plan, select from your existing App Service plans, or select Create new App Service plan and enter the name of a new plan.

trans-unit.source: For Resource Group, select from your existing resource groups, or select Create new resource group and enter a name.
trans-unit.target: For Resource Group, select from your existing resource groups, or select Create new resource group and enter a name.

trans-unit.source: For Access Level, select Available to Anyone.
trans-unit.target: For Access Level, select Available to Anyone.

trans-unit.source: You can restrict access later through the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: You can restrict access later through the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: For Region, select a region close to you.
trans-unit.target: For Region, select a region close to you.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Microsoft Azure Web App dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Microsoft Azure Web App dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the API App in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to create the API App in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: As this process can take a few minutes, Visual Studio displays a confirmation dialog.
trans-unit.target: As this process can take a few minutes, Visual Studio displays a confirmation dialog.

trans-unit.source: Click OK on the confirmation dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click OK on the confirmation dialog.

trans-unit.source: The provisioning process creates the resource group and API App in your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: The provisioning process creates the resource group and API App in your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio shows the progress in the Azure App Service Activity window.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio shows the progress in the Azure App Service Activity window.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Status notification via the Azure App Service Activity window</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Status notification via the Azure App Service Activity window</linkText>
